Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes, the end goal is to make a Go language code which works the same way as the `faucet` CC code works in C language.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: There are 2 types of CC code examples in FSM branch of jl777/komodo repo.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
1. The CC code written in C, which is compiled with the `komodod` and is available from within of `komodod`.
2. Same like 1, written in C, but compiles to an independent dynamic library, which sites right next to the `komodod` binary and is the `komodod` calls the RPC/API/methods from this library. It is the dynamic CC creation method, which doesn't need recompiling the whole `komodod` and only the CC code part. Makes the devs' life much better to only care about the CC code and also helps distribution of the CC to end users in updates when/if needed.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: You should check both examples of this inside compiled komodod CC code, and the dynamic linkable CC code which compiles to library file.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: What James asked is the 2nd option.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Just understand the 2nd way, dynamically linkable CC code lib, and try to make that in Go language üôÇ

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @jl777c can probably point where to look for it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there are 2 ways to do it, you can crete wrappers for the functions you need to call, or you can try to rewrite all of them in Go.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: for the signing of transactions, there is actually a new way that cuirrently isnt used, that allows to sign the tx with existing wallet code.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I will be experimenting with this in comming weeks after the fork is done. Maybe it will be of some help.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: catntell you how to use it, but I can show you where it is.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/blackjok3rtt/komodo/blob/jl777/src/script/sign.cpp#L195
here. It requires to use the ccopt params, which places basically an op_return on the end of the cccvout itself. Then it needs the pubkeys in there, itlooks like it will see if the pubkey is in the wallet then sign the tx with that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this should remove the need for FinaliseCCtx and all those extra steps, for some cases. I dont hink it automatically works with all existing CCs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because it cant know the eval code if the opt params dfont exist, so it has no key to sign with

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there are a bunch of changes in Verus using this, I tried to port them over  but failed. I think it doesnt amtter though because that stuff is backwards compatible

Content:
@ashwin 
```shell
Satinders-MBP:~ satinder$ ls -lha /usr/local/include/
total 0
drwxrwxr-x  64 satinder  admin   2.0K 14 Jun 23:52 .
drwxr-xr-x  15 root      wheel   480B 11 May 22:58 ..
lrwxr-xr-x   1 satinder  admin    35B 11 May 23:00 adns.h -> ../Cellar/adns/1.5.1/include/adns.h
lrwxr-xr-x   1 satinder  admin    42B 11 May 23:00 assuan.h -> ../Cellar/libassuan/2.5.3/include/assuan.h
lrwxr-xr-x   1 satinder  admin    42B 12 Jun 04:10 autoopts -> ../Cellar/autogen/5.18.16/include/autoopts

Content:
```shell
Satinders-MBP:~ satinder$ ls -lha /usr/local/Cellar/
total 0
drwxrwxr-x  59 satinder  admin   1.8K 14 Jun 23:52 .
drwxr-xr-x  15 root      wheel   480B 11 May 22:58 ..
drwxr-xr-x   3 satinder  staff    96B 11 May 23:00 adns
drwxr-xr-x   3 satinder  staff    96B 12 Jun 04:09 autoconf
```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```shell
sudo chown -R `whoami`:staff /usr/local/Cellar/
sudo chown -R `whoami`:admin /usr/local/include/
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
This https://pypi.org/project/komodorpc/ thing looks not actual (or maybe vice versa it's very fresh I just never saw it before üòÉ )
I'm using this RPC client: https://github.com/barjomet/slick-bitcoinrpc
`pip3 install setuptools wheel slick-bitcoinrpc`

Then in your code:
```from slickrpc import Proxy
kmd_rpc_proxy = Proxy("http://%s:%s@127.0.0.1:%d"%(rpcuser, rpcpassword, int(rpcport))```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
and execute calls via proxy as:
```getinfo_output = kmd_rpc_proxy.getinfo()
getrawtransaction_output = kmd_rpc_proxy.getrawtransaction(txid)
```
and so on

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://github.com/tonymorony/komodo-cctools-python you can find some usage examples in this repo

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://gist.github.com/tonymorony/3194c70f1f2c6b303fe22c59a2894080 also example of simple RPC wrapper based on requests (but it works slower than slickrpc)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `Even if set rpc_port as 7776 in komodo.conf file, i dont understand why it starts the daemon on 8405` how did you check that RPC port is 8405 in your case?
